Little did I know 12 years later that I would trust him not only with filing my taxes, but also trust him with his advice on decisions I have made with business and family matters. I recommend him because he is honest, trustworthy, and takes a personal interest in taking care of his clients.

They found some things that turbox was doing wrong and redid 2 years of my taxes plus this current year to help me lower my tax bill. Excellent customer service and a quick turnaround time

name: Ron Waddell
text:
Bryan Parker has been my accountant and financial adviser for over ten years. I find him to be very honest, extremely knowledgeable, dedicated to serving his clients, and easy to do business with. I would highly recommend him and his staff to anyone looking for either an account or financial adviser.

I find it really reassuring to know Bryan is on your side when I receive those irritating letters from the IRS.

Ron Waddell
Sterrett, Al

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Ron. We strive to provide the highest level of service to our clients.

name: Lee Dykes
text: No one looks forward to tax season, but Bryan Parker, CPA, and his staff help ease the anxiety of filing the necessary forms on time and with accuracy.

name: Kurt de klerck
text: Bryan and his team do fantastic work , they are friendly and they always help you out in case you have any questions . I feel lucky to have them as my accountant and would only trust Bryan l Parker and his team with all my business related items .

name: Marjorie Berguson
text: We feel very comfortable to have Bryan Parker do our tax returns.  He is very prompt and efficient.

name: Iceeu (Sonshine)
text:
I had to give a star to review Mr. Parker. My. Parker is the Accountant for my neighborhood's H.O.A. I was relatively new to the neighborhood just buying my home 2 years prior to investigating the H.O.A. I was unable to get any financial information from the only board member so I went to Mr.Parker.
His Secertary was so kind and very helpful and I appreciated that. She told me Mr. Parker was not in the office after returning from an office. I asked her some questions and she went back and forth to the same office with answers to the question's. I them saw a man comes from the office leaving and got on the elevator headed down. I know this today to be Mr.Parker, as she walked past the man was wearing a T-SHIRT advertising his business Bryan L. Parker Accounting. I later sent him emails requesting his presence at our Association meeting, I never received a reply.
I realize that all of this blame doesn't lie solely at Mr.Parkers feet, it lies equally at his feet and that of our Association President's feet. I received contradictory answers for questions I asked. As a homeowner I and my neighbors pay a fee to Mr. Parker and as an employee he should have been able to answer everyone of my questions and he did not. It is my opinion and the opinion of many of my neighbors that Mr. Parker made no effort to assist us with any information at all at several different requests and times. To us that is shady behavior.

resp.text: This post appears to have some misunderstandings. First of all, whoever was seen walking past, if you were told I was not in the office, was not me. We do not have t-shirts advertising our business so I would question if you were even at our office, since you have inaccurate information. Secondly, we are not employees of the HOA, we are contracted by the HOA board to handle certain accounting functions and provide the board with requested reports. Similar to any business, the reports are disseminated from the top (HOA) to those who need to know. Privacy laws are very strict and we try to adhere to them diligently. If you want more access to information of your HOA, I suggest you become a member of the board. As I understand it, several requests have been made for more board participation but thus far there have been no takers. If you become a board member, we would be glad to share appropriate information with you.

name: Mike Bennighof
text: Highly professional in all aspects.

name: Jeremy Thompson
text: He got me a ton more back on my personal taxes than doing it myself online.  Will be back next year for sure!

text: She is a strong Christian who is always looking out for others. Carol is extremely helpful. She knows what questions to ask inorder to help you get the most money back for your taxes. Carol's prices are amazing. She was several hundred dollars cheaper than H&R Block. Not only that you never know who you get when you step into a big box tax service. name: Roland Patterson
text:
Hung out to dry!!!
Don't count on any help from these people. THEY MAKE MISTAKE on my tax return. Caused me to be audited by state. Had ALL RECEIPTS FOR DEDUCTIONS. Now I'm out an extra 2600.00. They say we can't help you. ALL BECAUSE THEY LEFT OFF MY DEDUCTIONS!!!

resp.text: Thanks for your reply but with any audit,  state or federal,  proving deductions  when asked is imperative.  Refusing or not complying to provide requested info usually has negative results.

name: Heather Juron
text: This was our 2nd year filing with this company as they were referred to us. We recently received a letter from state saying there was a mistake in our filings in which we owe more. I have called 5 times and still waiting on someone to call me even after I emailed the letter from state over a month ago. I will never recommend them to anyone or go back to them. Awful customer service and do not care about their customers. You are better off going to H & R Block who pulled someone off the street to do your taxes. Same service.

name: Stan Shoemaker
text: Do I really have to give a star? Went to see Brenda about getting some past tax issues taken care of, we sat in her office while she supposedly ordered my documents online and said they would take 10-14 days to get here. I waited and waited, then at week 4 I called to see what was going on and also emailed her, she has yet to return my calls or email. It’s obvious now that the documents were never ordered, and it turns out that these could have been gotten online Instantly while I was there. She knew I was in a time crunch yet she could care less about clients or making money, this would have earned her around $1,000. I don’t see the point in wasting mine and her time that day knowing full well she had no intention of handling my case, just lied right to my face.  Needless to say, I have ordered the documents myself and will be going to a different accountant to handle them for me.

name: Murphree Joy
text: I was a new client with a 4:00 APPOINTMENT.  At 4:30 I had still not been called back.  When I inquired they said Brenda Blevins worked her co-worker’s client in in front of me.   Someone could’ve told me that. Someone could’ve called me and told me to come in a little later. Then they said well there’s a man back here that can wait on you. They could’ve offered that initially. I told them I thought they were very unprofessional, their office was not run very well and that I would take my business elsewhere. Don’t go here!

name: Lee Madkin
text: Good tax people! Very professional staff!

text: As a previous client of Brenda Blevins for about 2 years, both business and personal, I would not recommend her services.  I experienced late tax filings, rude staff members(some, but not all), and numerous communication errors.  This is likely due to the large staff turnover, which is typically not a good sign.

name: candi campbell
text: Thanks for all you do
